t: Revelation 7
144,000 Sealed
After*p this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds of the earth to prevent any wind from blowing on the land or on the sea or on any tree.
Then I saw another angel coming up from the east, having the seal of the living God. He called out in a loud voice to the four angels who had been given power to harm the land and the sea:
“Do not harm the land or the sea or the trees until we put a seal on the foreheads of the servants of our God.”
Then I heard the number of those who were sealed: 144,000 from all the tribes of Israel.
From*pln the tribe of Judah 12,000 were sealed, from*ln the tribe of Reuben 12,000, from*ln the tribe of Gad 12,000,
from*ln the tribe of Asher 12,000, from*ln the tribe of Naphtali 12,000, from*ln the tribe of Manasseh 12,000,
from*ln the tribe of Simeon 12,000, from*ln the tribe of Levi 12,000, from*ln the tribe of Issachar 12,000,
from*ln the tribe of Zebulun 12,000, from*ln the tribe of Joseph 12,000, from*ln the tribe of Benjamin 12,000.
The Great Multitude in White Robes

After*p this I looked, and there before me was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, tribe, people and language, standing before the throne and before the Lamb. They were wearing white robes and were holding palm branches in their hands.
And they cried out in a loud voice: “Salvation*pn belongs to our God, who*ln sits on the throne, and*ln to the Lamb.”
All*p the angels were standing around the throne and around the elders and the four living creatures. They fell down on their faces before the throne and worshiped God,
saying: “Amen!*pn Praise*ln and glory and*ln wisdom and thanks and honor and*ln power and strength be*ln to our God for ever and ever. Amen!”*ln
Then*p one of the elders asked me, “These in white robes—who are they, and where did they come from?”
I*p answered, “Sir, you know.” And*p he said, “These are they who have come out of the great tribulation; they have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
Therefore, “they*pn are before the throne of God and*ld serve him day and night in his temple; and*ln he who sits on the throne will*ld shelter them with his presence.
‘Never*ln again will they hunger; never*ld again will they thirst. The*ln sun will not beat down on them,’ nor*ld any scorching heat.
For*ln the Lamb at the center of the throne will*ld be their shepherd; ‘he*ln will lead them to springs of living water.’ ‘And*ld God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.’”
